title: Quality of Rs. 6,259Mn worth medicine compromised due to improper storage
body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); The quality of medicines worth Rs. 6,259 million has been damaged due to improper storage methods, it has been revealed during a recent COPA (Committee on Public Accounts).
The medicine stock has been damaged due to improper storage during the period of nearly 10 years from 2011 to 2020.
In its first report on the Second Session of the Ninth Parliament, the COPA pointed out that the medical supply stores have not been maintained in a proper condition.
The COPA further found out that 99% of the medicines have been administered to patients despite being found that the quality of the medicines have been compromised.
Moreover, it has been observed that it has not yet been possible to recover the cost of drugs that have been damaged due to this.
The Public Accounts Committee added that the Ministry of Health currently does not have a system in place to check the quality of medicines as soon as they are received.
